body_html:
@psyhtest I usually build master branch. Yes, I sent this PR in Jan, 2018 when I was trying to build TF Lite at that time. I use TensorFlow master on the board and build pip package from time to time since then.

Regarding the offsetof(), which is supposed to be defined in stddef.h, problem, I don't know why NVIDIA's Linux doesn't define it. Maybe Denver 2 of TX2 is weird. However, I think something like

#define offsetof(type, member) ((size_t)* ((type *) 0)->member)

should work most of the time. And for HiKey 960, which Linux distro your use?

Regarding the offsetof(), which is supposed to be defined in stddef.h, problem, I don't know why NVIDIA's Linux doesn't define it. Maybe Denver 2 of TX2 is weird. However, I think something like

body:
@psyhtest I usually build master branch. Yes, I sent this PR in Jan, 2018 when I was trying to build TF Lite at that time. I use TensorFlow master on the board and build pip package from time to time since then.

Regarding the offsetof(), which is supposed to be defined in `stddef.h`, problem, I don't know why NVIDIA's Linux doesn't define it. Maybe Denver 2 of TX2 is weird. However, I think something like
```
#define offsetof(type, member) ((size_t)* ((type *) 0)->member)
```
should work most of the time. And for HiKey 960, which Linux distro your use?
